WRITING.TITLE: Normal player vs Building glitch abuse player
PSA: DayZ can not utilize overclocked CPU amp; GPU
WRITING.TEXT: I am using i7-5820k, 980Ti and ASUS mobo. I just ran a monitoring software and played Dayz for a while. The result data is clear: the frequency of my CPU will stop at 3.3GHz forever, which is the stock frequency, so as GPU, the core frequency will stay at stock frequency 1190MHz, ALTHOUGH I HAVE ALREADY SAT OVERCLOCK. Hardwares today are smart, they only overclock when under pressure, however, DayZ is very nice to our PC that it won't push your hardwares. For example, a non-overclocked i7-5820k will automatically boost to 3.6GHz if needed, which is called "smart boost", 980Ti can also do auto-overclock. And I also did a comparison with other games(GTA5, Fallout4, Armored Warfare, DOTA2, ARMA3) and some benchmark software, they did let my hardware overclocked.(5820k can OC to 4.5 w/o problem on my PC, 980Ti can go up to 1690MHZ as intend) ps: if someone can tell my how to make my pc work harder while playing DayZ I will be appreciate. (I didn't run DayZ at lowest setting, I sat to middle or high)

WRITING.TITLE: PSA: Freshly caught wild pokemon's level is not always ODD integer.
WRITING.TEXT: http://pokemongo.gamepress.gg/pokemon/1 This site mentioned that "Note: All Pokemon freshly caught in the wild are ODD integer levels. ", this is not right. I just caught a Ponyta that had a level of 16 (my trainer lv is 23). It spent 1900 stardust to power up, and it was freshly caught, that meant this Ponyta was level 15 if that theory was right, but it had a CP of 659, which is higher than maximum cp of level 15 (649.81). I then powered it up, it took two time to reach level 17 (2200 cost), knowing that 1 Power Up = 0.5 level, it once again confirmed to be a level 16 wild Ponyta.

We are also working on Summoner rework so it will take longer to come out a idea. TLDR: Magical characters are OP in luke raid, such as Battle mage, Dark templar, Asura, Necro, Soul blender. WRITING.TITLE: CDNF M.Striker meme
DayZ devs' logic
Current performance of all T10 tanks.
WRITING.TEXT: gt; gt; gt; gt;XM1A3: Fire power: Ready rack is good and you can reload at 1/2 and only take 8 seconds. In this case, you can fire 3 shells in 10s by shot one gt; reload gt; shoot 2. Defense: Garbage, the frontal armor is weak as hell, but side ERA is terribly strong. However, this will be nerfed in 0.20 and by then it will be a paper tank. The turret is very strong as long as you hide your turret ring, which is very large. Mobility: Turret rotation speed is so terrible that rotating your body is faster. gt; gt; gt; gt;Leopard 2AX: Firepower: Current very bad, will be buffed to 900mm pen in 0.20. Defense: Nothing. Mobility: The only thing leopard has now. gt; gt; gt; gt;Challenger2: Firepower: Super OP PISH round that can rekt Armata in seconds, will be nerfed in 0.20. Defense: Commander hatch can be penned for full damage. Very weak against HEAT/PISH. Driver hatch is no longer a weak spot unless you shot in 90 degrees and within a very close range. Mobility: Nothing outstanding here. gt; gt; gt; gt;Armata: Firepower: +35% damage against heavy armor, which makes him very strong against other MBT. Pen will be buffed in 0.20 which makes him even powerful. Defense: The entire turret is nearly invulnerable and turret ring is very small. Upper frontal armor is only weak to PISH round. Hiding your lower frontal armor will make you very tough. Mobility: Outstanding. gt; gt; gt; gt;T-15 HIFV: Firepower: Autocannon nerfed to the ground and it became a missile boat. Defense: Turret can be penned for full damage and frontal armor is noticeably weaker than before. Mobility: Nerfed to the ground and now it's as slow as MBTs. gt; gt; gt; gt;Sphinx: Firepower: Another missile boat. However, he has the chance to spray autocannon to enemies asses with his mobility. Defense: No longer has a trolling frontal armor. Mobility: Still fast. gt; gt; gt; gt;Cent155: Firepower: Much weaker than PZH2000. Will be buffed in 0.20. Defense: Occasionally bounce incoming fire with his upper frontal armor. Mobility: Fast enough to play close quarter arty. gt; gt; gt; gt;PL01: Firepower: Very stable damage output with its accuracy, ROF and penetration. Defense: God-like in PVE, can't even get a scratch. The lower frontal armor is the only noticeable weakness. Nearly immune to autocannons. Mobility: The overdrive skill is deleted but it is still fast.

WRITING.TITLE: (Guys pls claim down) Some info about Chinese ADs, Tencent and PUBG.
WRITING.TEXT: 1. Tencent bought 70B Korea Won of Bluehole or not? False. The deal has not done yet, but the talk is ongoing. 2. Tencent weibo (Chinese twitter) posted a post about Tencent will run PUBG server within China, but they deleted soon. (Please note that this is what Tencent usually do. 2 years ago Tencent released rumor about owning CSGO in China, but soon busted. Tencent is known for posting biased news and unconfirmed news, especially among gamers field, where 80% of them are barbarians lul) 3. The Chinese AD is about a Chinese network accelerator. Due to some network construction issues and large land area, Chinese gamer has fought against lag for a long time. Also, Chinese gov limited and censored international network usage so this is used to break the limitation if someone wants to play outside AS server. 4. This Chinese network accelerator, XunYou, works with Tencent. 5. Rumor says Tencent is helping PUBG build Chinese server. As you guys already know, Tencent is a network behemoth company, he can deal with a lot of things with money and power. (100% of Riot, 51% of Epic, 100% of Supercell, pls say Hi) 6. A very famous Chinese "LOL exclusive" streamer just signed a deal and became "PUBG exclusive" streamer. Personally, I don't think Tencent is not aware of this.

WRITING.TITLE: How to avoid Chinese hacker 101
WRITING.TEXT: 1. Don't play at Chinese prime time (UTC+8, from 7 pm to 3 am) 2. Play FPP for less hacker. 3. Don't play solo, it was a disaster. 4. Accept your fate when there is an obvious hacker doing killing feed. 5. Take a break from the game.

WRITING.TITLE: Touch of Death
No worry about someone breaking into your house
I am really pissed off when some people say they barely met hackers.
WRITING.TEXT: The situation is here: this game is currently poisoned with hackers, and it's not entirely blueballs and BE's fault, it's the fate of a popular PC FPS game just like R6 Siege, CSGO and Arma. To those who think I am exaggerated, you may: 1) Died before a hacker gets to you. This happens when a hacker wants to lay low for the early game. 2) Usually play in low hacker population server. A good example will be EU FPP prime time, when most Chinese hackers are asleep. Speaking of hacker population, TPP solo mode is basically unplayable, try your best to avoid this mode. My roommate just tried in NA TPP solo when I am shitposting this, all of his 4 rounds had brutal hackers like 566453636 or WG-qun guys. 3) Hacker died before he gets to you. Note that not all hackers are brutal WG-QUN guys, many of them can be killed. 4) Wasn't aware of the mouse marco. This is prob the most prevalent hack type but you can easily tell it by their shot interval and their distance to you. If you have advantages and enough skill you can still kill them, but this doesn't make them not hackers. 5) Non-lethal hacker. i.e. a noob wall hacking guy who gets killed in a face-to-face gunfight. Anyway, I am looking forward to comments like "800 hours played, only 2 hackers blablabla". Also, my in-game-id is BoomBoomDollar, criticism is open for anyone who thinks I am noob because I am always whining about hackers.

WRITING.TITLE: Updated news about Tencent's Chinese PUBG.
WRITING.TEXT: Here are some news about these things, for more details please wait for Tencent's announcement on Dec 1. 1. Chinese PUBG will run on Tencent's Wegame platform, the price is 98 RMB which is exactly the same as Steam Chinese region price. 2. Chinese mainland steam users who already have PUBG in their steam library can still play this game and will NOT be region locked. 3. Steam users log in via Chinese mainland IP can no longer see PUBG in the steam store page. This means they can no longer purchase this game with a CN IP. 4. Playing PUBG in Tencent's Wegame requires an age of 18+ and must be verified with personal ID. 5. One thing that I don't know: Does Chinese PUBG has their own server, or can still connect with other regions? We know that KR/JP users have their own game launchers(Kakao, DMM) but can still play with people from other regions. 5. Just saying, new map requires a different playstyle, many players didn't adapt, thus hate comes.
WRITING.TEXT: Most players, including many of them in this sub, already adapted to a "prone inside bushes" or "capture amp;defend a house in the middle of the white circle" playstyle. However, none of them are available in new map: In Mirimar, playstyles are: 1) Loot: Players have to drop into large cities because of loots are not evenly spawning, or at least not as that spread as Erangel. As a result, players have to do hide and seek during the first two circles in large cities with a severe rubberbanding. (PS: I really don't mind drop into the fighter club in Pecado, but the rubberbanding made me unable to pick up a gun) 2) Travel: Due to the large size of the new map, players need to find vehicles to move, but the vehicle spawn locations are not as visible as the old map (there is no garage in the new map, or haven't found out one.) Consequently, dropping toward roads may end up with no vehicle and no gears. 3) Geometry. As I mentioned, vehicles are needed, but the geometry is very unfriendly to driving. Driving into some glitch location or flip while forced to drive on a mountain can really piss off some players. 4) Gunfight. Most buildings in Mirimar are horrible to defend because of the bad view, and there are not too much grass and trees in the wild, thus players are forced to shoot in the open, which is very hard for some casual players. Mirimar actually has a very complex geo and you can find some good covers too, but most players are already dead before they can be familiar with the map. What if Mirimar was released before Erangle? Will people piss off by Erangel because of too much grass? For those who are suffering the Mirimar, can we talk about Adaption?

WRITING.TITLE: FPP is the best anti-cheat
As a Chinese player, I don't think region lock will save the game from the current situation.
WRITING.TEXT: As a legit Chinese player who also got completed ruined by hackers in recent days, I sometimes wanted region lock same as players in foreign regions, but honestly, I don't think that can work out. 1. There is still no detail on anything about region lock, we don't even know if it's gonna happen. It seems like PU himself doesn't want it, because region lock will enrage many Chinese players(include hackers). Yes, Tencent had done region lock before but doesn't mean it will do this time. CSGO and Dota2, which are run by Perfect World, don't even have region lock at all, so this is not required by Government. 2. Chinese people are good at bypassing Internet block. As /u/gomico mentioned in his recent post, VPN that used to play games is called game network accelerator and it's not treated as those to access banned media websites like FB, youtube, NYT. Game companies like NetEase and Tencent all have their game VPN, and a famous game VPN called QiYou is even sponsored by PUBG. Recently, China Government banned steam community, but most Chinese ppl just open their game VPN to access steam like nothing happened. So, if PUBG is region locked they could just bypass it with some click click. Remember that game VPNs are much cheaper than PUBG and hack software! 3. Code flaw. PUBG's code is too vulnerable to hack and re-write this can take much longer. I like how some users in this sub dreaming of Tencent's anti-cheat but I can tell you that Tencent's own games like Crossfire, DNF and NiZhan are still having a lot of hackers. 4. Famous PUBG streamers in China use hacker very obviously but only a very few of them get punished. Tencent is counting on them to promote the game and many of them are former League of Legend pro players (Royal Whitezz, PDD), which has a solid relationship with Tencent and a large number of fans. Hacking in PUBG is slowly becoming a cultural thing.

(This sounds like how Dota2 is handled in China, one can register a standalone Chinese account and link this to an existing steam account to transfer items/data, or just play without linking) 2. Rumor says alpha server start on Jan 15. This is usually used for testing network stability. 3. Linking to steam account function will no longer be available after March 31. 4. (My speculation) It looks like PUBG China will work like how dota2 is running in China: For a standalone client user who plays this game with QQ account, he can only play within Chinese server. For steam users who linked their account, they can play in Chinese server using steam launch option like "-Tencent" or play in the global server as usual. Client in Internet cafes will also become "Tencent's version" by default. 5. There is still no news from Tencent about region lock. But Dota2 is no longer available for Chinese steam users, I am guessing region lock is coming. (Notice: Chinese steam users can still obtain Dota2 via VPN)

[Chinese PUBG drama]An infamous hacker streamer got un-banned. "He was banned by mistake" saying Bluehole.
WRITING.TEXT: An infamous Chinese hacker streamer Muo-yin-nuo-mi, who was banned directly by PUBG Chinese division staff, was un-banned today. Previously, according to Bluehole's English reply to him, he cheated indeed. Meanwhile, Bluehole's Chinese statement said: "he was banned mistakenly". The funny part about this is: No one thinks he is innocent. One of the clips that led to his ban, where he shot 17 SKS rounds in 2 seconds and perfectly landed in one spot, quickly became a meme among Chinese PUBG community. This action once again raised the untrust against PUBG in CN community. 1. How is he unbanned while confirmed as balant hacker? 2. What if other banned streamers could get unbanned too? 3. If Bluehole can revise the ban, what about those who got falsely banned but never unbanned? The shitshow is getting shitty. Source in Chinese, from PUBG Chinese official weibo account: https://weibo.com/ttarticle/p/show?id=2309404215322226912012 In case someone ask, one of the videos he hack while streaming: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sDd7jSDd5lk Edit1: The main reason that Bluehole unbans him is that they think they misjudged. However, Muo-yin-nuo-mi (the hacker) posted a Bluoehole's reply in his personal account after he got banned, it said: "Bluehole double checked his account and decided that he was cheating". These conflicting moments make the entire story funny AF. Also, I apologized for the low-quality videos, this is the only one I can find on youtube and seem like has been uploaded and downloaded over and over. He is an indeed infamous balant hacker that why we shocked and scared so much: How could he get unbanned. Edit2: He is the first famous hack streamer that got banned. After this, another famous streamer 55kai (formerly LOL pro player known as Royal.Whitezz) and Mr.Snake (Another retired LOL pro player) got banned too. There was no doubt that these people were all hacking, thus CN players are fear of the hacker streamers' comeback. Edit3: Even in China, the largest playerbase of PUBG, people are starting to lose faith to PUBG too. Not all Chinese player hack and legit players hate hacker as much as EU/NA guys too. They were dreaming of Bluoehole, BE and Tencent eliminating hacker together. But now, while the hacker issue is still losing control, a banned streamer magically got unbanned. Online shooter games like R6, Fortnite are beginning to gain popularity in China as player escaped from PUBG due to hacker issue. PU and Bluehole, please take your ego away and act like a major company worth of 7b dollars FFS.

WRITING.TEXT: Little did westerns know, but Chinese went into an "unofficial" trade war against South Korea last year because South Korea deployed THAAD to defend nukes from their north bros. Most Chinese people and governments thought that Kim's nuke was not threatening enough to SK, instead, they thought the reason that SK built up THAAD was to monitor Chinese military data. As a result, an unofficial trade war began, including force some Korean supermarkets to close, limit Korean imported products, TV shows, and outgoing travelers to SK. One of the Korean most famous export things is their video games. And, due to the limitation, Chinese gave 0 license to Korean game since March 2017. In March 2018, a Chinese high-rank guy Yang Jiechi promised that Chinese would remove the limitation on Korean stuffs, but it may take some times to work out. Source: http://cnnews.chosun.com/client/news/viw.asp?cate=C01 amp;mcate=M1002 amp;nNewsNumb=20180449567 amp;nidx=49568 The Chosun Ilbo is one of the major newspapers in SK. The source is in Chinese version because I can't read Korean. Additional read, for those who has no idea about THAAD: https://thediplomat.com/2016/02/what-is-thaad-what-does-it-do-and-why-is-china-mad-about-it/

WRITING.TITLE: To ASUS mobo user who is experiencing game crashes
WRITING.TEXT: My PUBG frequently crashes in almost every game for weeks after I installed my newly purchased ASUS mobo (ROG Z270) and I had no clue. I tried everything to fix it but it wouldn't work. Yesterday I came to notice that my AI Suite 3 (ASUS's CPU overclock software for ASUS Motherboard) put my CPU OC voltage to 1.5v. This is done by their "auto optimization" and I didn't notice this because I can't believe this software could allow such high voltage value. (CPU voltage is usually around 1.0v and can go up to 1.2v when overclocking, but 1.5 is nonsense.) I reset this value to default and my PUBG never crashed again. tldr; Check your damn AI Suite 3 if you using their 5-way optimization.

WRITING.TITLE: Male Ranger.gif
So I came across a Chinese wu-xia PUBG copy...
You got me!
The worship, misunderstanding or overthinking of Tencent and PUBG's relationship has to go away.
WRITING.TEXT: Q: Why did Tencent buy 10% of PUBG Corp. A: Tencent is just doing its job as a large Chinese investment company. You can also see Tencent's logo in a lot of Hollywood movies too. Q: Will the acquisition make PUBG better? A: Not likely. Tencent has invested a lot of companies (51% of Epic, 5% of Ubisoft, 100% of Supercell and Riot, and possibly a small part of Activision, Nintendo, Nexon, and Capcom). The point is that Tencent just did the investment for the profit and he usually didn't step into their game development. (Tencent had convinced Nexon to make an exclusive version of Dungeon Fighter Online for Chinese region, and this is more likely because this game is only popular in China now) Q: The investment has to change something right? A: Probably YES. After Tencent signed a deal with Activision, Call of Duty series was region locked and pulled off from Steam Chinese region. So Tencent can make Call of Duty Online (a special version that only runs in China, with creepy graphics and p2w features.) Since Tencent already signed the deal with PUBG Corp to run PUBG in China, it's just a normal action for Tencent to buy some stake from them. Q: What about the Chinese government? A: Chinese government can't touch oversea companies, which means you don't need to worry about losing your personal information by playing League of Legend. Q: How good is Tencent at developing games? A: Tencent barely made worldwide popular games, but their games did very well inside China, mostly because Tencent is single-hand controlling all the social software in China and has a large number of loyal customers that other foreign game developers could only dream of. Tencent had made a lot of p2w shitty copycat games but turned them into money printers. These kind of games are unlikely to survive outside China. Q: Can Tencent help PUBG Corp by sending out #8220;good developers according to redditors #8221; A: As I said Tencent barely stepped into game development of the companies they purchased. I'd say, NO. Tencent will be more likely to hire good developers to help its local PUBG running. Q: Is Tencent good at Anti-Cheat? A: Technically yes but the cheating problem in PUBG is more because of bad and unprotected code. Tencent's own games have a looooooooot of cheater too and players are still criticising Tencent for adding the anti-cheat software "Ten-Protect" that significantly slow down the game performance and system stability. Q: How strong is Tencent connected to CN gov? A: Ironically, Tencent is just a puppet of CN gov. They grew large with the help of gov, and did the investment for the gov, which is totally fine. But Tencent can also be smashed by gov: Tencent made a deal with Capcom to run Monster Hunter: World in China on their own game platform WeGame, but it was taken down only 1 day after the launch due to censorship and reports from citizens (LMAO). Tencent also planned to run R6 but it was censored due to the word "Rainbow" is related to LGBT which is strictly banned in China (LMAO x2). As you can see right now, Tencent hasn't been able to get a license to run PUBG as a result of the ban on all Korean games due to Chinese and South Korean's conflict over THAAD. tldr. Tencent is just doing an investment like other big Chinese companies (Alibaba, Netease, Gov-owned Oil companies, etc). It won't influent PUBG that much as redditors' imagination.

WRITING.TEXT: **Smoke Screen** : Riki releases a burst of purple dust that deals damage and silences enemy units nearby. **Blink Strike** : Riki launches a ninja shuriken that flies in a straight path, damaging enemy units along the way. WRITING.TITLE: I haven't seen too many posts discussing two new guns (M762 amp; MK47). How do you guys feel about them?
WRITING.TEXT: IMO M762 is kinda garbage because of the insane recoil. Although it has a crazy high DPM but having almost 2x recoil than AKM is not even funny. It's good for face-spray but hard to hit anything further than 50m. MK47 on the other hand feels pretty awesome, definitely better than his 5.56 counterpart (M16) when single tapping, but its 2-round burst is pretty garbage in close combat and totally useless in mid-ranged.

WRITING.TITLE: The leaderboard rating (MMR) is inflating too quickly.
WRITING.TEXT: [https://pubg.op.gg/leaderboard/?platform=steam amp;mode=tpp amp;queue\_size=1](https://pubg.op.gg/leaderboard/?platform=steam amp;mode=tpp amp;queue_size=1) #8203; Take a look at those Grandmaster MMR. WRITING.TITLE: [Suggestion]Since new weapon is a Pistol, now it's the time to buff pistols overall in PUBG
WRITING.TEXT: Pistols have been pretty much useless since PUBG started, time to fix it otherwise people would still skip pistols. #8203; 1. Switching to pistols should be faster than switching to your 2nd weapon. 2. People should be allowed to using pistol while \[Driving\] \[Using Medical items\] \[Throwing Grenades\] 3. People should be able to open doors with F key in ADS mode if holding a pistol. 4. Some weak pistols should be already loaded when picked up. This encourages people to pick pistol when hot drop. (1911, p92, r1985) 5. Removes pistol quickdraw magazine. (Totally a pointless item and maybe reduce the server load by 1% LUL) 6. Add our boi Desert Eagle. Large caliber pistol is a life saver.

Smurfer/Boosted Account is also ruining games in CN server.
WRITING.TEXT: In case you are thinking that the reason Valve doesn't give a shit about booster account is because at least half of them are from China...Legit Chinese players, including pros are suffering from this for a long time. Currently, in very high mmr ranked games in CN region, if someone was confirmed as a boosted account, all of his teammates will go "Chappie" and let the game end asap. Due to "culture" reason, Chinese love ranked RD mode and this is a perfect place for booster (you are less likely to get countered if you pick meepo/brood/huskar -- the go-to heroes for booster, and you can't vote to ban). Also ranked role games in minority regions make things even easier. A week ago a dude with name "I bought this account, if you flame me I will feed mid" ruined a lot of games in top MMR games, and Chinese pros "had to be nice" to him to prevent him from feeding again.

WRITING.TITLE: (Jan 26) My Personal Tier List
WRITING.TEXT: Tier S (You should get them no matter what line-up you are using, they are just too useful): Shadow Fiend: Don't forget to sell him in the end game if you are not playing warlock/mage build. His ult gives free mana to enemy nuke hero, game losing useless ult. Templar: A geared TA can wipe out an entire mage line-up. Beast Master: His damage is just too strong in the early-mid game. Tide: Best CC, useful in most builds. #8203; #8203; Tier A (Core pieces you need in your strat): Razor: Core member of the mage and element build. 2x2 star Razor is better than 1 3star. Remember this. Crystal Maiden: Useless in early game but critical in late game due to her mage debuff and aura. You need 3 mages. All goblins: Goblin strat is the go of this patch. GUYro: 2nd Best mage. Enigma: Best front liner of element strat. Necro: You need him in hunter strat. Lich: Best mage, very powerful in the late game due to mage buff. Kunkka: 2nd best CC. #8203; #8203; Tier B (Very powerful and you should use them in your strat to get a top3 spot) Doom: Doom is everyone's dad. Troll: Best all-around physical damage dealer aka Nian monster slayer. PA: Le balanced crit lady. Slayer: OSFrog fishy fishy. QOP: good damage, garbage AI. DK: Only viable in dragon build but hell yeah. TB: Put all your gear on him to make sure he doesn't die. Jugger: Put one 2star jugger in your front line. Lycan: Early game winner. #8203; Tier C (You are just here to fill the role): The pieces you need to complete your build, but soon be replaced. Druid: Win early, lose later, but still viable. #8203; Tier F (I dont know what the fuck you are doing here) Tiny: Intentionally throwing. Drow: Seriously what the fuck. AXE: AXE..no more. Lina: Dumbest bitch. KOTL: Half life 3 will come out when he finishes his charge wave. Batride: You still need me to complete your troll strat, don't you? VINO: LOL #8203; #8203; #8203; #8203;
